content: this is dmg and we're gonna make a letter that's come on
okay a ladder so we are going to take a wall segment as you have seen in
previous videos except this time we are not going to curve the edges we're going
to leave it straight with probably enough space suit on that one and a half
inches of space there into that we are then going to draw a square with one
side against the wall so that's leaving about a half an inch right around and
each side so it's about one inch across then we're going to get some excess
cardstock and cut it into strips so each strip is probably half a centimeter in
length and then cut a half centimeter little bricks a little flat bricks and
some hot glue and we're just going to dump those bricks on there now in order
to maneuver those try not to use your fingers I would just use a toothpick or
something as you can see here just grab a toothpick and before it cures quickly
push them into alignment so it's very easy to do that and then just more hot
glue and replace it just gonna jump ahead here so this is forming the edge
of the hole where the ladder is going to be coming out of so you can descend down
this ladder if you want to make a ladder where it's going up through the ceiling
you can skip the step I also applied some of the bricks against the wall just
for some added the gutro more it keeps your more then we're going to grab some
matchsticks these matchsticks of five centimeters wide two inches ere we're
gonna measure right in to the middle so two and a half centimeters 1 inch
whichever it is and Mark those and then cut them in half the parent scissors so
this next part is a little bit delicate we're going to place the blobs of hot
glue on each side of these half matchsticks and then we're going to
stick them down to two parallel lines so these match half matchsticks are about
one inch so these parallel matchsticks are about one inch
apart so that you can see they're a little bit delicate expect to have high
volumes of wisps and if you want to listen the amount of glue I just use a
toothpick to clear up the joins and continue this process on you want to set
them about a half an inch apart going down a ladder and leave about the one
side with more space than the other side so the area with more space is going to
be the top of the ladder and the area with the list space is going to be the
bottom it applies a hot glue to the bottom of the ladder and place it about
two-thirds of the way along the inside what is essentially the hole and then
some blobs of hot glue and stick it down now if you want to do in the later at a
painting stage you can apply the letter after painting you know that's
completely up to you so that's what it looks like at this point in time but
before we get to the painting let's talk about Neverwinter the maze engine very
very cool little game I'm playing it all the time now my barbarian horde is

then sponging on some Brown onto the ladder and there you go
